content: "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/frank-schaeffer/open-letter-to-the-republ_b_172822.html" This was written by Frank Schaffer. His Conservative credentials are impeccable: quote: I used to be one of you. As recently as 2000 I worked to get Senator McCain elected in that year's primary. (McCain and Gen. Tommy Franks wrote glowing endorsements regarding my book about military service, AWOL.). I have a file of handwritten thank you notes from Presidents Ford, Reagan, Bush I and II. In the 1970s and early 80s I hung out with Jack Kemp and bought into his "supply side" myth and even wrote a book he endorsed pushing his ideas.) There's more, but take it from me; my parents (evangelical leaders Francis and Edith Schaeffer) and I were about as tight with -- and useful to -- the Republican Party as anyone. We played a big part creating the Religious Right. His father help create the Christian Right "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Schaeffer" He has a son in the Marines who fought in the Iraq war. But he eviscerates today's GOP quote: You Republicans are the arsonists who burned down our national home. You combined the failed ideologies of the Religious Right, so-called free market deregulation and the Neoconservative love of war to light a fire that has consumed America. Now you have the nerve to criticize the "architect" America just hired -- President Obama -- to rebuild from the ashes. You do nothing constructive, just try to hinder the one person willing and able to fix the mess you created. Its a good read.

content: Frankie has been a disgruntled dude most of his life. He attempted fill daddy's shoes but could never even tie his father's shoe laces. Sadly, what Frankie never figured out was - the ONLY person comparing him to his father was HIM! It's truly sad - Frankie situation is very similar to Julian and John Lennon. Those who loved John would have accepted Julian on his own merits - but Julian couldn't accept himself. I not blaming him - its just a bummer because he is talented. Frankie - is and was - a spoiled punk who happened to be surrounded by some very good thinkers - and privileged to be educated by an elite crowd. He copped and attitude long before his father died. He is and was ARROGANT and THAT is why he "left the religious-right". He wanted people to bow & worship "HIM" because "HE" was FRANKIE the "SON" of Francis - the writer, poet, screen-write, yada, yada, yada... bummer dude for Frankie - because no-one was impressed with his work... IMHO - Frankie is more like a Bill Ayres type guy except Frankie was one of those who "hung-out" with the radicals so everyone else would think he was cool! Then when folks did get to know him – they walked away thinking he was a big @$$**** - and some even told him so… So, Frankie pouted… Here’s the irony - His article fits him to a tee – just do a “Find & Replace” – in the FIND box type “republican” – and in the REPLACE box below type – “Frankie” and THEN you get the picture… That article is about FRANKIE SCHAFFER… betraying his parents! Both his mother & father were brilliant people. content: "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/frank-schaeffer/open-letter-to-the-republ_b_172822.html" This was written by Frank Schaffer. His Conservative credentials are impeccable: quote: I used to be one of you. As recently as 2000 I worked to get Senator McCain elected in that year's primary. (McCain and Gen. Tommy Franks wrote glowing endorsements regarding my book about military service, AWOL.). I have a file of handwritten thank you notes from Presidents Ford, Reagan, Bush I and II. In the 1970s and early 80s I hung out with Jack Kemp and bought into his "supply side" myth and even wrote a book he endorsed pushing his ideas.) There's more, but take it from me; my parents (evangelical leaders Francis and Edith Schaeffer) and I were about as tight with -- and useful to -- the Republican Party as anyone. We played a big part creating the Religious Right. His father help create the Christian Right "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Schaeffer" He has a son in the Marines who fought in the Iraq war. But he eviscerates today's GOP quote: You Republicans are the arsonists who burned down our national home. You combined the failed ideologies of the Religious Right, so-called free market deregulation and the Neoconservative love of war to light a fire that has consumed America. Now you have the nerve to criticize the "architect" America just hired -- President Obama -- to rebuild from the ashes. You do nothing constructive, just try to hinder the one person willing and able to fix the mess you created. Its a good read.

content: Frankie has been a disgruntled dude most of his life. He attempted fill daddy's shoes but could never even tie his father's shoe laces. Sadly, what Frankie never figured out was - the ONLY person comparing him to his father was HIM! It's truly sad - Frankie situation is very similar to Julian and John Lennon. Those who loved John would have accepted Julian on his own merits - but Julian couldn't accept himself. I not blaming him - its just a bummer because he is talented. Frankie - is and was - a spoiled punk who happened to be surrounded by some very good thinkers - and privileged to be educated by an elite crowd. He copped and attitude long before his father died. He is and was ARROGANT and THAT is why he "left the religious-right". He wanted people to bow & worship "HIM" because "HE" was FRANKIE the "SON" of Francis - the writer, poet, screen-write, yada, yada, yada... bummer dude for Frankie - because no-one was impressed with his work... IMHO - Frankie is more like a Bill Ayres type guy except Frankie was one of those who "hung-out" with the radicals so everyone else would think he was cool! Then when folks did get to know him – they walked away thinking he was a big @$$**** - and some even told him so… So, Frankie pouted… Here’s the irony - His article fits him to a tee – just do a “Find & Replace” – in the FIND box type “republican” – and in the REPLACE box below type – “Frankie” and THEN you get the picture… That article is about FRANKIE SCHAFFER… betraying his parents! Both his mother & father were brilliant people. All anyone needs to do is read a few books from his father – then read Frankie’s… After the first chapter or two – well, where’s that page marker – I’ll get back to this book latter… then it goes on the shelf…

content: "http://www.huffingtonpost.com/frank-schaeffer/open-letter-to-the-republ_b_172822.html" This was written by Frank Schaffer. His Conservative credentials are impeccable: quote: I used to be one of you. As recently as 2000 I worked to get Senator McCain elected in that year's primary. (McCain and Gen. Tommy Franks wrote glowing endorsements regarding my book about military service, AWOL.). I have a file of handwritten thank you notes from Presidents Ford, Reagan, Bush I and II. In the 1970s and early 80s I hung out with Jack Kemp and bought into his "supply side" myth and even wrote a book he endorsed pushing his ideas.) There's more, but take it from me; my parents (evangelical leaders Francis and Edith Schaeffer) and I were about as tight with -- and useful to -- the Republican Party as anyone. We played a big part creating the Religious Right. His father help create the Christian Right "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_Schaeffer" He has a son in the Marines who fought in the Iraq war. But he eviscerates today's GOP quote: You Republicans are the arsonists who burned down our national home. You combined the failed ideologies of the Religious Right, so-called free market deregulation and the Neoconservative love of war to light a fire that has consumed America. Now you have the nerve to criticize the "architect" America just hired -- President Obama -- to rebuild from the ashes. You do nothing constructive, just try to hinder the one person willing and able to fix the mess you created. Its a good read.

In the 1970s and early 80s I hung out with Jack Kemp and bought into his "supply side" myth and even wrote a book he endorsed pushing his ideas.) There's more, but take it from me; my parents (evangelical leaders Francis and Edith Schaeffer) and I were about as tight with -- and useful to -- the Republican Party as anyone. We played a big part creating the Religious Right.

content: Frankie has been a disgruntled dude most of his life. He attempted fill daddy's shoes but could never even tie his father's shoe laces. Sadly, what Frankie never figured out was - the ONLY person comparing him to his father was HIM! It's truly sad - Frankie situation is very similar to Julian and John Lennon. Those who loved John would have accepted Julian on his own merits - but Julian couldn't accept himself. I not blaming him - its just a bummer because he is talented. Frankie - is and was - a spoiled punk who happened to be surrounded by some very good thinkers - and privileged to be educated by an elite crowd. He copped and attitude long before his father died. He is and was ARROGANT and THAT is why he "left the religious-right". He wanted people to bow & worship "HIM" because "HE" was FRANKIE the "SON" of Francis - the writer, poet, screen-write, yada, yada, yada... bummer dude for Frankie - because no-one was impressed with his work... IMHO - Frankie is more like a Bill Ayres type guy except Frankie was one of those who "hung-out" with the radicals so everyone else would think he was cool! Then when folks did get to know him – they walked away thinking he was a big @$$**** - and some even told him so… So, Frankie pouted… Here’s the irony - His article fits him to a tee – just do a “Find & Replace” – in the FIND box type “republican” – and in the REPLACE box below type – “Frankie” and THEN you get the picture… That article is about FRANKIE SCHAFFER… betraying his parents! Both his mother & father were brilliant people. All anyone needs to do is read a few books from his father – then read Frankie’s… After the first chapter or two – well, where’s that page marker – I’ll get back to this book latter… then it goes on the shelf…
